Sprites.Sprite: A blank tile that contains no graphic. Mario/Luigi can pass through all sides
The center tile of the grassland tile set from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A brown block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A blue block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The center tile of the forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The dirt (or sand) of the forest tileset from Super Mario World.

An invisible tile that has no graphics and doesn't allow Mario/Luigi to go through it.
Note: Level2Pic displays a graphic for these invisible tile. If you don't want it to be visible, change "Location" to "133, 265" (without quotations).
An empty question block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A block that turns around for about several seconds and then turn backs to a normal block. If Mario or Luigi is "in" the turn block, it will keep turning until he gets away.
A piece of Bowser's bridge from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The center tile of the cave tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A brick that breaks when Mario or Luigi hits it above in Super/Big form.
A brick that breaks when Mario or Luigi hits it above in Super/Big form.
The center tile of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The bottom left tile of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.

An invisible tile that has no graphics and doesn't allow Mario/Luigi to go through it.
Note: Level2Pic displays a graphic for these invisible tile. If you don't want it to be visible, change "Location" to "133, 265" (without quotations).
The center tile of the tree top platform tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left tile of the tree top platform tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right tile of the tree top platform tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A single tree trunk tile from the tree trunk tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left side of the tree trunk tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The center tile of the tree trunk tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right side of the tree trunk tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The top left part of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The top right part of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left part of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right part of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A single castle block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right part of a long stone block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left part of a long stone block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right wall part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left wall part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left curve part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right curve part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right corner part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left corner part of the castle tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The center part of a snowy ground tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The top left part of a white pipe tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The top right part of a white pipe tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left part of a white pipe tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right part of a white pipe tileset from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left corner tile of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The left wall tile of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The right curve tile of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The left curve part of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The right corner part of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
The right wall of a forest tileset from Super Mario World.
A question block that contains a star, allowing Mario or Luigi to become invincible.

A question block that contains a Mushroom (if Mario or Luigi is small or ducks down when activated) that will make him big, or a Fire Flower (if Mario or Luigi is big) that will allow him to shoot fire balls.
A question block that contains a random amount of coins.
A lava that kills Mario or Luigi upon contact. When a mushroom touches lava, it will hop.
A platform that makes Mario or Luigi goes up. When Mario or Luigi goes all the way up to the game's screen, Mario or Luigi falls.
A platform that makes Mario or Luigi goes down. When Mario or Luigi goes all the down the game's screen, Mario or Luigi dies.
A platform that makes Mario or Luigi goes left and right automatically.
A platform that makes Mario or Luigi goes left and right upon contact. If Mario or Luigi don't go on the platform, then it will stop moving.
A platform that makes Mario or Luigi fall down upon contact after several seconds.
A coin that Mario or Luigi can collect. Getting 100 of these coins allows Mario or Luigi to gain an extra life.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A brown Goomba that walks forward until it hits an object and then turn around.
A blue Goomba that walks forward until it hits an object and then turn around.
A fireball that jumps out of lava (or something) and goes back down, repeatingly.
A Bullet Bill cannon that shoots Bullet Bills to the left side of the screen continuously.
A turtle that have spikes on its shell. Stepping on these spikes will downgrade or kill Mario or Luigi.
A green Koopa Troopa that walks and falls off ledges.
A green turtle that shoots hammers at Mario or Luigi while hopping or walking. It is usually accompanied with another Hammer Brother.
A jumping, green Koopa Troopa that jumps around. When Mario or Luigi steps on it, the jumping Koopa Troopa will turn into a regular green Koopa Troopa.
A firebar that rotates around an empty coin block.
A Pirannah Plant that dwells in pipes. It comes out of the pipe unless Mario or Luigi unless is near it.
A turtle that surfs the sky on a cloud throwing a maximum of 4 Spiny eggs at Mario or Luigi. If a block is in the way of Lakitu, it will stop.
A Piranah Plant that stands. If Mario or Luigi touches the plant, he will downgrade or die.
A flying Parakoopa Troopa that flies up and down in the sky. Hitting the top of the Parakoopa will change it back into a regular green Koopa Troopa.
A Bullet Bill cannon that shoots toward the right of the screen continuously.
A red Koopa Troopa that goes back and forth and doesn't fall off ledges.
A jumping red Koopa Troopa that jumps around. When it is hit on the top, it turns into a regular red Koopa Troopa.
A flying red Koopa Troopa that flies up and down in the sky. When it is hit on the top, it turns into a regular red Koopa Troopa.
A black bettle that walks and falls off ledges and surprisingly can be killed with a fire ball.
The King of the Koopa. He spits out fireball and walks and jumps around. Shooting him with fireballs continuously will turn him into die as a Goomba.
A Bullet Bill that heads toward the left.
A Bullet Bill that heads toward the right.
A flying flame that heads toward the left.
A flying flame that heads toward the right.
A blue block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
A brown block from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. However, this block can't be erased. Used as the bottom of the flagpole.
A ghost that follows Mario or Luigi when he is not looking. Otherwise, he will follow him.
The top of a horrizontal pipe facing right of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The bottom of a horrizontal pipe facing right of a green pipe from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The left side of a vertical pipe facing down colored green from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The right side of a vertical pipe facing down colored green from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The top of a horizontal pipe facing left colored green from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The bottom of a green horrizontal pipe facing left from Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros.
The bottom tube of a green horizontal pipe.
The top tube of a green horizontal pipe.
A tile that automatically lets you win upon touching. Mario or Luigi will do the V-sign and the "End Level Theme" will play.

The pole of the flagpole. When it is all by itself, Mario or Luigi will display the V-sign and the "End Level Theme" will play. When it is together with a flagpole, Mario or Luigi will slide off the flagpole and the victory animation will be played.
The flag of the flagpole. The flagpole animation will be played when Mario or Luigi touches it.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.

A hidden question block that gives Mario or Luigi a coin when he hits it from the bottom.

The stem of a tree, used for both small and large trees.
A white small bulb used as a tree.

A fence covered with snow.
A regular fence.
A possible null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can not put anything where the null tiles are situated.
A tile that represents the starting point of Mario or Luigi in the level. This tile automatically creates the whole start point image.
The bottom of the start point. This tile is null by default, and it isn't necessary needed because Tile 146 (Start Point - Top/Whole) creates the whole thing.
The top of the yellow golden door from Super Mario World that is used as a warp point.
The bottom of the yellow golden door from Super Mario World that is used as a warp point.
A null tile that allows Mario or Luigi to pass through all sides. However, you can nout put anything where the null tiles are situated.

A zombie turtle that walks and falls off of ledges. When Mario or Luigi steps on it, it will be "dead" temporarily and go back to normal.
A large stone that falls when Mario or Luigi is near it, and then goes back up.
